intro: Gomphia coriacea, commonly known as the rough gomphia, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Restionaceae and is characterized by its woody, shrub-like structure. The plant features narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, clustered inflorescences. It thrives in coastal and sandy environments, often in areas with high salt exposure. Gomphia coriacea is adapted to arid conditions and has a slow growth rate.
